00020 #ifndef _PASSENGER_SPAWN_OPTIONS_H_

00023 #include <string>

00028 using namespace std;

00030 /**
00031  * This struct encapsulates information for ApplicationPool::get() and for
00032  * SpawnManager::spawn(), such as which application is to be spawned.
00033  *
00034  * <h2>Notes on privilege lowering support</h2>
00035  *
00036  * If <tt>lowerPrivilege</tt> is true, then it will be attempt to
00037  * switch the spawned application instance to the user who owns the
00038  * application's <tt>config/environment.rb</tt>, and to the default
00039  * group of that user.
00040  *
00041  * If that user doesn't exist on the system, or if that user is root,
00042  * then it will be attempted to switch to the username given by
00043  * <tt>lowestUser</tt> (and to the default group of that user).
00044  * If <tt>lowestUser</tt> doesn't exist either, or if switching user failed
00045  * (because the spawn server process does not have the privilege to do so),
00046  * then the application will be spawned anyway, without reporting an error.
00047  *
00048  * It goes without saying that lowering privilege is only possible if
00049  * the spawn server is running as root (and thus, by induction, that
00050  * Phusion Passenger and Apache's control process are also running as root).
00051  * Note that if Apache is listening on port 80, then its control process must
00052  * be running as root. See "doc/Security of user switching.txt" for
00053  * a detailed explanation.
00054  */
00055 struct PoolOptions {
00056         /**
00057          * The root directory of the application to spawn. In case of a Ruby on Rails
00058          * application, this is the folder that contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/',
00059          * etc. This must be a valid directory, but the path does not have to be absolute.
00060          */
00061         string appRoot;
00062         
00063         /** Whether to lower the application's privileges. */
00064         bool lowerPrivilege;
00065         
00066         /**
00067          * The user to fallback to if lowering privilege fails.
00068          */
00069         string lowestUser;
00070         
00071         /**
00072          * The RAILS_ENV/RACK_ENV environment that should be used. May not be an
00073          * empty string.
00074          */
00075         string environment;
00076         
00077         /**
00078          * The spawn method to use. Either "smart" or "conservative". See the Ruby
00079          * class <tt>SpawnManager</tt> for details.
00080          */
00081         string spawnMethod;
00082         
00083         /** The application type. Either "rails", "rack" or "wsgi". */
00084         string appType;
00085         
00086         /**
00087          * The idle timeout, in seconds, of Rails framework spawners.
00088          * A timeout of 0 means that the framework spawner should never idle timeout. A timeout
00089          * of -1 means that the default timeout value should be used.
00090          *
00091          * For more details about Rails framework spawners, please
00092          * read the documentation on the Railz::FrameworkSpawner
00093          * Ruby class.
00094          */
00095         long frameworkSpawnerTimeout;
00096         
00097         /**
00098          * The idle timeout, in seconds, of Rails application spawners.
00099          * A timeout of 0 means that the application spawner should never idle timeout. A timeout
00100          * of -1 means that the default timeout value should be used.
00101          *
00102          * For more details about Rails application spawners, please
00103          * read the documentation on the Railz::ApplicationSpawner
00104          * Ruby class.
00105          */
00106         long appSpawnerTimeout;
00107         
00108         /**
00109          * The maximum number of requests that the spawned application may process
00110          * before exiting. A value of 0 means unlimited.
00111          */
00112         unsigned long maxRequests;
00113         
00114         /**
00115          * The maximum amount of memory (in MB) the spawned application may use.
00116          * A value of 0 means unlimited.
00117          */
00118         unsigned long memoryLimit;
00119         
00120         /**
00121          * Whether to use a global queue instead of a per-backend process
00122          * queue. This option is only used by ApplicationPool::get().
00123          *
00124          * If enabled, when all backend processes are active, get() will
00125          * wait until there's at least one backend process that's idle, instead
00126          * of queuing the request into a random process's private queue.
00127          * This is especially useful if a website has one or more long-running
00128          * requests.
00129          */
00130         bool useGlobalQueue;
00131         
00132         /**
00133          * A throttling rate for file stats. When set to a non-zero value N,
00134          * restart.txt and other files which are usually stat()ted on every
00135          * ApplicationPool::get() call will be stat()ed at most every N seconds.
00136          */
00137         unsigned long statThrottleRate;
00138         
00139         /**
00140          * The directory which contains restart.txt and always_restart.txt.
00141          * An empty string means that the default directory should be used.
00142          */
00143         string restartDir;
00144         
00145         /**
00146          * Creates a new PoolOptions object with the default values filled in.
00147          * One must still set appRoot manually, after having used this constructor.
00148          */
00149         PoolOptions() {
00150                 lowerPrivilege = true;
00151                 lowestUser     = "nobody";
00152                 environment    = "production";
00153                 spawnMethod    = "smart";
00154                 appType        = "rails";
00155                 frameworkSpawnerTimeout = -1;
00156                 appSpawnerTimeout       = -1;
00157                 maxRequests    = 0;
00158                 memoryLimit    = 0;
00159                 useGlobalQueue = false;
00160                 statThrottleRate        = 0;
00161         }
00162         
00163         /**
00164          * Creates a new PoolOptions object with the given values.
00165          */
00166         PoolOptions(const string &appRoot,
00167                 bool lowerPrivilege       = true,
00168                 const string &lowestUser  = "nobody",
00169                 const string &environment = "production",
00170                 const string &spawnMethod = "smart",
00171                 const string &appType     = "rails",
00172                 long frameworkSpawnerTimeout = -1,
00173                 long appSpawnerTimeout       = -1,
00174                 unsigned long maxRequests    = 0,
00175                 unsigned long memoryLimit    = 0,
00176                 bool useGlobalQueue          = false,
00177                 unsigned long statThrottleRate = 0,
00178                 const string &restartDir  = ""
00179         ) {
00180                 this->appRoot        = appRoot;
00181                 this->lowerPrivilege = lowerPrivilege;
00182                 this->lowestUser     = lowestUser;
00183                 this->environment    = environment;
00184                 this->spawnMethod    = spawnMethod;
00185                 this->appType        = appType;
00186                 this->frameworkSpawnerTimeout = frameworkSpawnerTimeout;
00187                 this->appSpawnerTimeout       = appSpawnerTimeout;
00188                 this->maxRequests    = maxRequests;
00189                 this->memoryLimit    = memoryLimit;
00190                 this->useGlobalQueue = useGlobalQueue;
00191                 this->statThrottleRate        = statThrottleRate;
00192                 this->restartDir     = restartDir;
00193         }
00194         
00195         /**
00196          * Creates a new PoolOptions object from the given string vector.
00197          * This vector contains information that's written to by toVector().
00198          *
00199          * For example:
00200          * @code
00201          *   PoolOptions options(...);
00202          *   vector<string> vec;
00203          *
00204          *   vec.push_back("my");
00205          *   vec.push_back("data");
00206          *   options.toVector(vec);  // PoolOptions information will start at index 2.
00207          *
00208          *   PoolOptions copy(vec, 2);
00209          * @endcode
00210          *
00211          * @param vec The vector containing spawn options information.
00212          * @param startIndex The index in vec at which the information starts.
00213          */
00214         PoolOptions(const vector<string> &vec, unsigned int startIndex = 0) {
00215                 appRoot        = vec[startIndex + 1];
00216                 lowerPrivilege = vec[startIndex + 3] == "true";
00217                 lowestUser     = vec[startIndex + 5];
00218                 environment    = vec[startIndex + 7];
00219                 spawnMethod    = vec[startIndex + 9];
00220                 appType        = vec[startIndex + 11];
00221                 frameworkSpawnerTimeout = atol(vec[startIndex + 13]);
00222                 appSpawnerTimeout       = atol(vec[startIndex + 15]);
00223                 maxRequests    = atol(vec[startIndex + 17]);
00224                 memoryLimit    = atol(vec[startIndex + 19]);
00225                 useGlobalQueue = vec[startIndex + 21] == "true";
00226                 statThrottleRate = atol(vec[startIndex + 23]);
00227                 restartDir     = vec[startIndex + 25];
00228         }
00229         
00230         /**
00231          * Append the information in this PoolOptions object to the given
00232          * string vector. The resulting array could, for example, be used
00233          * as a message to be sent to the spawn server.
00234          */
00235         void toVector(vector<string> &vec) const {
00236                 if (vec.capacity() < vec.size() + 10) {
00237                         vec.reserve(vec.size() + 10);
00238                 }
00239                 appendKeyValue (vec, "app_root",        appRoot);
00240                 appendKeyValue (vec, "lower_privilege", lowerPrivilege ? "true" : "false");
00241                 appendKeyValue (vec, "lowest_user",     lowestUser);
00242                 appendKeyValue (vec, "environment",     environment);
00243                 appendKeyValue (vec, "spawn_method",    spawnMethod);
00244                 appendKeyValue (vec, "app_type",        appType);
00245                 appendKeyValue2(vec, "framework_spawner_timeout", frameworkSpawnerTimeout);
00246                 appendKeyValue2(vec, "app_spawner_timeout",       appSpawnerTimeout);
00247                 appendKeyValue3(vec, "max_requests",    maxRequests);
00248                 appendKeyValue3(vec, "memory_limit",    memoryLimit);
00249                 appendKeyValue (vec, "use_global_queue", useGlobalQueue ? "true" : "false");
00250                 appendKeyValue3(vec, "stat_throttle_rate", statThrottleRate);
00251                 appendKeyValue (vec, "restart_dir",     restartDir);
00252         }
00253 
00254 private:
00255         static inline void
00256         appendKeyValue(vector<string> &vec, const char *key, const string &value) {
00257                 vec.push_back(key);
00258                 vec.push_back(const_cast<string &>(value));
00259         }
00260         
00261         static inline void
00262         appendKeyValue(vector<string> &vec, const char *key, const char *value) {
00263                 vec.push_back(key);
00264                 vec.push_back(value);
00265         }
00266         
00267         static inline void
00268         appendKeyValue2(vector<string> &vec, const char *key, long value) {
00269                 vec.push_back(key);
00270                 vec.push_back(toString(value));
00271         }
00272         
00273         static inline void
00274         appendKeyValue3(vector<string> &vec, const char *key, unsigned long value) {
00275                 vec.push_back(key);
00276                 vec.push_back(toString(value));
00277         }
00278 };
